bill.title: An act relating to consumer protection
bill.description: An act relating to consumer protection

referrals.name: Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs

history.action: Read First Time and Referred to the Committee on Commerce & Economic Development
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Read Second Time
Rep. Botzow of Pownal reported for the committee on Commerce & Economic Development
Report of Committee on Commerce & Economic Development agreed to.
Third Reading Ordered
Rules suspended and bill placed in all remaining stages of passage as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Read Third time
Passed
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Rules
Referred to Committee on Economic Development, Housing & General Affairs per Temporary Senate Rule 44A
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing & General Affairs
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing & General Affairs
Read 2nd time, reported favorably with proposal of amendment by Senator Balint for Committee on Economic Development, Housing & General Affairs
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing & General Affairs agreed to
3rd reading ordered
New Business/Third Reading
Pending third reading, motion to amend Senate proposal of amendment offered by Senator(s) Sirotkin
Pending third reading, proposal of amendment agreed to
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rep. Botzow of Pownal moved that the bill be committed to the committee on Commerce & Economic Development which was agreed to.
Action postponed until 4/5/16 as moved by Rep. Dakin of Colchester
Senate proposal of amendment considered
Senate Proposal of Amendment concurred in with further amendment thereto, as offered by Rep. Dakin of Colchester
Rep. O'Sullivan of Burlington moved to amend the House proposal to the Senate proposal
Rep. Hubert of Milton raised a Point of Order
Amendment of Rep. O'Sullivan of Burlington ruled not germane
House message House concurred in Senate proposal of amendment with proposal of amendment
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment
New Business/House Proposal of Amendment
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment
Unfinished Business/House Proposal of Amendment
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment
Unfinished Business/House Proposal of Amendment
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment, text
Senator Mullin moved to concur in House proposal of amendment with proposal of amendment; text
Proposal of amendment amended on motion of Senator(s) Sears
House proposal of amendment concurred in with further proposal of amendment as moved by Senator(s) Mullin
Senate Proposal of Amendment to House Proposal of Amendment to Senate Proposal of Amendment agreed to
Senate message, House proposal of amendment concurred in with further amendment thereto
Action postponed until 4/26/16 as moved by Rep. Dakin of Colchester
Senate Proposal of Amendment not concurred in and Committee of Conference requested upon motion of Rep. Dakin of Colchester
Speaker appointed Marcotte of Coventry, Dakin of Colchester and Head of South Burlington as members of the Committee of Conference on the part of the House
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
House message House refused to concur in Senate proposal of amendment & requested Conference Committee; House Conference Committee members appointed
Committee of Conference appointed: Senators Mullin, Baruth, and Balint
Entered on Notice Calendar
Committee of Conference Report
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Baruth
Committee of Conference report; text
Committee of Conference report adopted
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
Rep. Turner of Milton moved to suspend rules and take up bill for immediate consideration
Which was agreed to
Committee of Conference report agreed to (House bill)
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
House message House adopted Conference Committee report
Delivered to the Governor on 5/19/16
Signed by Governor on 5/24/16
